intro: Aneilema calceolus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 cm and produces violet-colored blooms in shades of purple and blue. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth. Aneilema calceolus is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
